title: Sprint 08: Async, Queues & Integration
description: Decoupling logic, handling background jobs, and integrating external services.
items: 01- Event Driven Architecture: Decoupling logic, Dispatching events, Listeners
02- Listeners & Subscribers: Handling events sync vs queued, Event discovery
03- Queue System: Drivers (Redis/SQS/DB), Job class structure, dispatch()
04- Job Dispatching: dispatch(), delay(), chaining, batches, closures
05- Queue Workers: worker process service, timeout, memory limits, restarting
06- Horizon: Dashboard configuration, balancing strategies, metrics monitoring
07- Failed Jobs: Handling failures, retries, backoff strategies, UUIDs, table pruning
08- Scheduler: Cron setup, defining schedules, overlaps, onOneServer, maintenance
09- Notifications: Channels (Mail, DB, SMS, Slack), on-demand notifs
10- Mail System: Mailables, Markdown templates, attachments, queuing mail
11- Redis: Caching, Pub/Sub, pipelining, atomic locks usage for concurrency
12- Webhooks: Handling incoming hooks, signature verification, response requirements
13- Server-Sent Events / Websockets: Broadcasting overview, Reverb/Pusher basics
14- File Storage: S3 integration, local vs cloud disks, file visibility, streaming
15- Payment Integration Logic: Idempotency keys, webhook reconciliation patterns
